title: WTO head warns of retaliation risk after U.S. trade tariffs
text: March 12, 2018 / 9:35 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago WTO head warns of retaliation risk after U.S. trade tariffs Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BRASILIA (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump’s decision to slap tariffs on imported steel and aluminium could spark retaliation from other countries and lead to unforeseen consequences, the head of the World Trade Organization said on Monday. U.S. President Donald Trump announces a presidential proclamation placing tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, at the White House in Washington, U.S. March 8, 2018. REUTERS/Leah Millis Speaking to reporters after a meeting with Brazilian President Michel Temer, WTO Director-General Roberto Azevêdo said,“You know when it starts but not how it will turn out” when countries engage in mutual retaliation. Brazil has said it will seek exemption from the newly imposed tariffs. Reporting by Jake Spring; Writing by Bruno Federowski; Editing by Leslie Adler
